intro: Pleroma dubium, commonly known as the uncertain pleroma, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem. Pleroma dubium is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited geographic distribution.
